headline: Big Banks’ Earnings Offer Encouraging Consumer Picture as Economic Fears Linger
summary: JPMorgan Chase, the country’s largest lender, now expects one of its core credit quality measures to look more favorable this year.  Citigroup says a measure of delinquencies has improved from a year earlier.  “You see strong consumer spend and stable deposits,” Wells Fargo Chief Executive Charles Scharf told analysts Tuesday, “and those things just kind of paint a picture of a consistently strong consumer.”

headline: Wealth Management Is a Winner From Stocks' Rally
summary: Higher equity-market valuations boosted wealth-management units at Citigroup, Wells Fargo, and JPMorgan Chase, which like other large banks have been trying to expand those businesses to capture the steady fee income they generate.  Total client assets rose 8% to $2.4 trillion.  Executives said on a conference call Tuesday morning that they are striving to increase the unit’s revenue by pursuing more banking and lending business with wealth-management clients.

raw.headline: Wealth Management Is a Winner From Stocks' Rally
raw.summary: Higher equity-market valuations boosted wealth-management units at Citigroup, Wells Fargo, and JPMorgan Chase, which like other large banks have been trying to expand those businesses to capture the steady fee income they generate.  Total client assets rose 8% to $2.4 trillion.  Executives said on a conference call Tuesday morning that they are striving to increase the unit’s revenue by pursuing more banking and lending business with wealth-management clients.

headline: Citigroup (NYSE:C) Beats Expectations in Strong Q3
summary: Global financial services giant Citigroup (NYSE:C) announced better-than-expected revenue in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 9.3% year on year to $22.09 billion. Its GAAP profit of $1.86 per share was 8% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Results Were Strong. Bank Stocks Are Still Getting Hit Hard.
summary: Bank stocks fell Tuesday morning even as some of the nation’s largest banks reported strong third-quarter earnings. The KBW Bank Index was down 0.7% compared with a 1.1% decline for the S&P 500. JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs were among those hardest hit, with shares down 3.

headline: Big Bank Profits Expected to Climb as Credit Concerns Ripple Across Wall Street
summary: Analysts expect the four biggest U.S. banks to tell shareholders this week that their profit and revenue rose from a year earlier, even as investors voice concerns over credit quality and lending standards that two high-profile corporate bankruptcies highlighted this fall.
